availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas H. Atkinson (Taylor County, Kentucky laborer, soldier (USA))

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky laborer, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James A and Clemmy Atkinson. Married to Sarah Price Atkinson in Taylor County, Kentucky on March 5, 1860. Father of James L. Atkinson. Laborer in Taylor County, Kentucky in 1860. Indicted for larceny in Taylor County in 1861. Served as corporal 1st Louisville Provost Guard from October 3, 1861 to October 1862. Served as 2nd Sergeant in the 34th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) from October 4, 1862 to his promotion to First Sergeant on February 7, 1863. Reduced in rank to private on January 1, 1864, on charge of desertion from hospital. Discharged December 7, 1864.
